column2: To help consumers make informed decisions about health care, the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS) collects data about the cost and quality of care at over 4,000 Medicare-qualified hospitals.

The data set allows consumers to directly compare across hospitals performance measure information related to heart attack, emergency department care, preventive care, stroke care, and other conditions. The data is part of an Administration-wide effort to increase the availability and accessibility of information on quality, utilization, and costs for effective, informed decision-making.
hospitals, health care, medical, hospital costs, hospital quality

column5: Description
Name of the hospital
City in which the hospital is located
Two letter capitalized abbreviation of the State in which the hospital is located (e.g., AZ is Arizona)
Kind of organization operating the hospital: one of Government, Private, Proprietary, Church, or Unknown
Overall rating between 1 and 5 stars, with 5 stars being the highest rating; -1 represents no rating.
Above, Same, Below, or Unknown comparison to national hospital mortality
Above, Same, Below, or Unknown comparison to national hospital safety
Above, Same, Below, or Unknown comparison to national hospital readmission
Above, Same, Below, or Unknown comparison to national hospital patience experience
Above, Same, Below, or Unknown comparison to national hospital effectiveness of care
Above, Same, Below, or Unknown comparison to national hospital timeliness of care
Above, Same, Below, or Unknown comparison to national hospital effective use of imaging
